subject: RE: [junit] Re: Starter
msgSnippet: The FAQ is very good and answers a lot of really good questions. I am convinced that new members of this list are not taking the time to click on the link and
messageBody:
The FAQ is very good and answers a lot of really good questions. I am
convinced that new members of this list are not taking the time to click
on the link and go to the FAQ page and read it. Could new members be
sent two emails? The first would be the welcome to the group, feel the
lurve email and the second would be a copy of the FAQ, which is not that
long and shouldn't blow most people out of the water.

Just my 1/50th of a U.S. Federal note. :-)

Simon

-----------------------------------------------------------------
Simon P. Chappell simon.chappell@...
Java Programming Specialist www.landsend.com
Lands' End, Inc. (608) 935-4526


>-----Original Message-----
>From: geektank [mailto:emeade@...]
>Sent: Wednesday, January 16, 2002 1:25 PM
>To: junit@yahoogroups.com
>Subject: [junit] Re: Starter
>
>
>--- In junit@y..., "Chappell, Simon P" <simon.chappell@l...> wrote:
>> Perhaps the first page of THE FINE MANUAL that I just know we all
>have
>> READ, should be a short guide on how not to get flamed crispy with
>your
>> first post to the email list?
>>
>> Or we could try a FREQUENTLY ASKED NEWBIE QUESTIONS as the normal
>FAQ is
>> obviously not cutting it for some people.
>>
>> Just a thought!
>>
>> Simon
>>
>> P.S. Welcome! They don't bite too bad around here ... once you get
>the
>> first couple of stupid questions out of your system! :-)
>>
>
>I've included the email that is sent to people when they join the
>list, if anyone has any suggestions I'm listening.
>
>Hello,
>
>Welcome to the JUnit group at Yahoo, a
>free, easy-to-use email group service. Please
>take a moment to review this message.
>
>If you do not wish to belong to JUnit, you may
>unsubscribe by sending an email to
>
>junit-unsubscribe@yahoogroups.com
>
>You may also visit the Yahoo web site to modify your
>subscriptions:
>
>http://groups.yahoo.com/group/junit
>
>Before you send a question to the list please take a
>moment to read How To Ask Questions The Smart Way:
>
>http://www.tuxedo.org/~esr/faqs/smart-questions.html
>
>Your question may already have been answered in
>Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs):
>
>http://junit.sourceforge.net/doc/faq/faq.htm
>
>There is also a good chance that someone else has
>already asked the same question, if so you can save
>yourself a lot of time by searching the list:
>
>http://groups.yahoo.com/group/junit
>
>To start sending messages to members of this group,
>simply send email to
>
>junit@yahoogroups.com
>
>Regards,
>
>Moderator, junit
>
>
